column4: The OEM must have the PMA (Premarket Approval) from the USFDA for thequoted model

column2: Facility of real time feedback onchest compression rate anddepth
column4: Real time CPR help on Chest compression rate and depth for adult, paed andneonate patients as per AHA 2020 latest guidelines
The quoted model should have "Advisory defibrillation" facility, and shouldhave preferably Rectilinear Biphasic waveform technology.
The quoted model must have facility to filter out CPR artifacts from thepatent's ECG while performing chest compression to access the underlyingrhythms without interrupting chest compressions

column7: All the accessories to be supplied with the equipment should be suitable forPaed. and Neonate patients. Apart from the standard accessories tennumbers of disposable Neonatal SPO2 Probe, and two number of NeonatalNIBP cuff are to be supplied. Demonstration of the quoted model is must.The 12 numbers of pads/gel sheets as asked above should be suitable forpaediatric and neonatal patients (6+6).
